en: God places the man in a garden He has prepared.
He provides generously, gives meaningful work, and sets a clear boundary.

lines: The Lord God planted a garden in the east, in Eden,
and there He placed the man He had formed.
The Lord God caused all kinds of trees to grow from the ground—
trees that were pleasing to the eye
In the middle of the garden
and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
The Lord God took the man
and placed him in the Garden of Eden
and to take care of it.
The Lord God commanded the man, saying,
“You are free to eat from any tree in the garden,
but you must not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
When you eat from it, you will surely die.”

question.en: What do you notice about the way God combines provision, responsibility, and command?
